intro: Manilkariopsis tabogaensis, commonly known as the Taboga manilkariopsis, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
